content: अपदिश् {c6c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} To point out, indicate, show; तदागतित्वेनाहमपदेश्यः <ls>Dk. 60</ls>; assign, allot. {@--2@} To declare, put forward, adduce, communicate; announce, say, tell; inform against, accuse; अपदिश्यापदेश्यं च <ls>Ms. 8. 54.</ls> {@--3@} To feign, pretend, hold out or plead as a pretext or excuse; मित्रकृत्यमपदिश्य <ls>R. 19. 31</ls>, <ls n="R. 19.">32</ls>, <ls n="R. 19.">54</ls>; शिरःशूलस्पर्शनमपदिशन् <ls>Dk. 56</ls> pleading head-ache as an excuse. {@--4@} To refer to, have reference to; रहसि भर्त्रा मद्गोत्रापदिष्टा <ls>Dk. 102</ls> referred to, called by the name of.
